page.title: 08Public Transport
page.content: Chesterfield Public Transport Bus Depot is situated about half a mile to the north of the town. The transport department employs three hundred and seventy-four staff of which two hundred and thirteen are drivers and conductors. About one million seven hundred thousand people make use of the service each year. There are seventy-one single-deck and forty-six double-deck buses in use at this time. The first public buses start at four o'clock in the morning the main users at this time being miners being taken to the local collieries. The busiest time of the day is one o'clock in the afternoon and the busiest day is Friday. The Depot has its own Social Club where the employees can play snooker, darts etc. between shifts or in the evening with their families.
